title: Love Island's Molly-Mae Hague avoids Amber Gill at glitzy launch party
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest Daily Love Island stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Molly-Mae Hague and Amber Gill have been plagued by feud rumours since the Geordie babe became the surprise winner of Love Island 2019.

And last night it looked like there might be some hope for the friendship, as Molly-Mae, 20, turned up to support her at her MissPap launch party.

But despite it being the prime opportunity to squash rumours of any catfights, the pair managed to avoid each other all night.

They weren't pictured together once as Molly-Mae, 20, spent the night joined at the hip with her boyfriend Tommy Fury, 20.

Dressed in a white power suit with padded shoulders, the influencer cut a fierce figure as she posed for photos.

(Image: SplashNews.com)

(Image: SplashNews.com)

She opted to go braless under the suit, which she wore with a chunky silver necklace and a matching white handbag.

Her blonde locks were slicked back in a ponytail and she donned a silver bracelet and ring to tie the outfit together.

Tommy showed off his muscles in a tight silk shirt and skinny black trousers, pairing them with his favourite spiked loafers.

(Image: SplashNews.com)

(Image: SplashNews.com)

Amber sported an asymmetric mini dress from her range, which is currently on sale for £17.50.

She showed off new black locks, that were styled in long tumbling curls.

The beautician sported a pair of perspex heels and added a touch of colour to her look with a coat of fluorescent orange nail polish.

(Image: SplashNews.com)

(Image: SplashNews.com)

Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now

Also at the bash was Anna Vakili, who flashed her underwear in a sheer striped dress.

Yewande Biala donned a black bra top and matching mini skirt, which she teamed with matching strappy heels.

Georgia Steel went for a similar look with a bra that flashed both her cleavage and underboob, while she covered her shoulders in a black coat.

(Image: SplashNews.com)

Many Love Island fans interpreted Amber's MissPap launch announcement to be a dig at Molly-Mae.

In her Instagram post she said her range would be open to all shapes and sizes and she'd played a big part in the design process.

It seemed to be in response to Molly-Mae's Pretty Little Thing collection, which many criticised for not having a diverse size range, as well as accusing her of not designing it.
description: The pair weren't pictured together once as Molly-Mae spent the night joined at the hip with her boyfriend Tommy Fury
